Update to Net 7 / Net 4.8

Remove unnecessary PenAlignment usage.

The documentation for Pen.Alignment states that PenAlignment.Right is treated as PenAlignment.Center when using the Pen for drawing lines.

I tested the appearance of the ITF-14 barcode and removing the Pen.Alignment setting makes no observable difference in the output. This is consistent with the documentation.

Fix dynamic assembly memory leak, optimize Regex usage

- performance optimization for Regex usage (reduces cpu time, memory, and dynamic assembly leakage)

- fix dynamic assembly memory leak by changing XmlSerializer to be static

Fix positioning in example app
Merge branch 'use-packagereference'

BarcodeStandardExample: Use implicit package references.

By setting RestoreProjectStyle to PackageReference in
Directory.Build.props, the entire solution is opted into using
PackageReference-style nuget restore, even if those packages do not
themselves have any direct PackageReference. This means that any
PackageReference to another project will automatically pull in the
nuget packages of that other project. For BarcodeStandardExample, this
means that it will automatically get the version of
System.Drawing.Common used by BarcodeStandard.

This may be a little sloppy, in that removing a PackageReference from
BarcodeStandard may break the build of BarcodeStandardExample. But I
think the simpler project files and reduced number of
manually-maintained PackageReference is worth it. And such a break
should be caught by CI.

This gets rid of packages.config usage. The packages.config style of
referencing nugets is old-style and the very fact that this puts
Reference and HintPath in the .csproj is unfortunate. So it is good to
move away from that.

Merge pull request #117 from barnhill/update-drawing-common

Update to 5.0.0 of System.Drawing.Common, Add JSON Serialization

Code128: Remove Code128Entry struct.

This should be slightly more memory efficient. Uses the index of the
list as the value instead of storing the index in the element
itself. Reverse lookup of the symbolic name of a particular barcode
pattern is replaced with dictionary key probing which happens for the
initial character and when switching codes.

See #123, addresses comments by @jangernert.
Code128: Reuse a calculation result instead of recalculating it.
Code128: Remove some dead code.

code128: Remove DataTable and support netcoreapp5.0.

Fixes #123 by avoiding the use of DataTable which used non-strict
string comparison and instead using Dictionary<string, TKey> which
uses strict string value comparison.

By removing DataTable, we can use more efficient and type-safe data
structures for code128 generation. Though, due to how the data
structures are rebuilt for every code generation, this change may
actually degrade performance.

Update CI to install netcore 3 and 5 side-by-side for tests.

This is done by using multiple install steps, one for each version we need.
Update CI to use dotnet-5.0.103 so it can run tests.

Add tests demonstrating issue #123.

Enables running tests on netcoreapp5.0 and net472.

Adds tests which break on netcoreapp5.0 due to the issue described in
#123.

Make CODE128 tests fail with a stacktrace when possible.

This makes debugging certain issues a lot easier.

See #123.

Add some rudimentary tests for existing CODE128 behavior.

Preparation for changes for #123.

Preset the DPI of created Bitmap instances.

This consolidates all constructions of Bitmap to go through a common
method, providing a place to set the resolution. See #98.

This also presets the resolution to 96DPI for the generated Bitmap to
help further isolate the library from any effects that the system DPI
might have on operation. See #100.
Cleanup
Fix checkdigit summation and calculation, cleanup

Ignore system DPI when setting default font size.

Treat the destination bitmap as 96DPI which preserves the existing behavior
for most users of the library and also causes consistency between
different systems when used in a DPI-aware application such as a modern
WPF application.

Fixes #100.

https://help.github.com/en/github/writing-on-github/creating-and-highlighting-code-blocks

Remove unused solution configuration platforms

as far as I can tell, the `x86` and `.NET` platform configurations in `Barcode.sln` are not used anywhere and don't do anything.

Removed them to simplify things.

Migrate to PackageReference format

Migrates nuget package references from legacy packages.config to new PackageReference format using the Visual Studio tool.

Because BarcodeStandard was already using the new format but BarcodeStandardExample wasn't, it'd give assembly reference errors like: "The type 'Image' is defined in an assembly that is not referenced. You must add a reference to assembly 'System.Drawing.Common, Version=4.0.0.1, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=cc7b13ffcd2ddd51'." Fixes https://github.com/barnhill/barcodelib/issues/80
